thread.title: Ray Parlour RAPS on a Stormzy track - but how does it compare to other footballers spitting bars?
thread.title_full: Ray Parlour RAPS on a Stormzy track - but how does it compare to other footballers spitting bars?

author: Jon Moody
title: Ray Parlour RAPS on a Stormzy track - but how does it compare to other footballers spitting bars?
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Recently, we discussed the well-trodden career paths footballers embark on once they hang up their boots. 
Common choices may include punditry (Gary Neville), coaching (Zinedine Zidane) and acting (er, Frank Leboeuf). 
One of the potential options we didn't mention as a realistic choice was going into the music business as a professional rapper. 
And that's probably for good reason. "PLEASE, RAY! No more rapping, please!" (Photo: ArsenalTV) 
One of the Gunners' famous Invincibles, Ray Parlour , has brought this issue to the fore once again. 
During his co-hosting of talkSPORT's Breakfast Show, he took on a cover of Stormzy track Shut Up in front of the man himself - complete with bespoke Arsenal lyrics. 
It's quite something. Take a look for yourself: 
We've got to admit it's an admirable debut effort from Ray Pizzy. He gets particular credit for not only having his own original verses, but for crowbarring in "mandem" in there as well. It's a solid 7/10 from us. 
But how does that stack up against other footballers' efforts? Let's take a look... Yannick Bolasie vs Bradley Wright-Phillips - rap battle 
Back in 2014, Bradley Wright-Phillips "sent" for Yannick Bolasie by calling him out with this effort. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
A day later, Yannick responded: Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
It's clearly neither's first rodeo, that's for sure; they know what they're doing when it comes to the rap game. We're scoring Bradley 8/10 - but Yannick just edges this with 9/10 due to his stage presence. Well, he moves about a bit... John Barnes & Jamie Redknapp - Rappers' Delight 
Yes, we know you're probably expecting to see Barnes' efforts on World In Motion on here, but you've probably seen that five or six hundred times before. 
So here's the main man collaborating with Jamie Redknapp on Rappers' Delight: Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
This ticks a lot of boxes from us - classic song, spitting bars skill, powerful outfits. It's a 9/10. Paul Gascoigne - Geordie Boys 
If you've never seen or heard Geordie Boys before, you're in for a treat. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
Wow. There's really not much more we can say after that, is there? Other than 9/10, of course. Andy Cole - Outstanding
